page.title: 10The Staverton Cricket Club
page.content: The Club was formed in 1983 by a few local people who wanted to revive the game in the village.A Committee was elected and some friendly games arranged with local organisations like Staverton Builders and the Round Table. In 1985 there were 24 fixtures arranged .Some were rained off in the worst July and August in living memory. However the 36 playing members and the 34 non-playing members enjoyed the sound of leather on willow on a number of quiet summer evenings. Although the cricket was often entertaining and the friendly rivalry very evident the main purpose of the evening seems to be the adjournment to the local pub where there is much recounting of near misses,drinking of the local brew, and hearing the current gossip.
